96608.name: Rates for domestic letters (United States Postal Service (2018))
96608.description: Postage rates for domestic letters (in cents).
96608.datasetName: Postage rates - United States Postal Service (2018)
96608.s_name: Letter postage - United States Postal Service

source.name: Letter postage - United States Postal Service
source.additionalInfo: Postage rate refers to 1/2 ounces for 1863 and 1883. 1885 onward postage rates refer to 1 ounce letters. Two observations were reported for 1981, the average of the two observations is reported.

96609.name: Rates for stamped cards and postcards (United States Postal Service (2018))
96609.description: Postage rates for stamped cards and postcards (in cents).
96609.datasetName: Postage rates - United States Postal Service (2018)
96609.s_name: Stamped cards and postcards - United States Postal Service

source.name: Stamped cards and postcards - United States Postal Service
source.additionalInfo: Two observations are reported for 1981 and for 1975, the average rate has been taken. In 1925, the rate for stamped cards is reported, however, postcards in the same year cost 2 cents. For the year 1873 note: Postcards (privately printed cards) did not qualify for a special postage rate until July 1, 1898. Since then, the rates for postcards have been the same as for stamped cards (produced by the Postal Service) except for the period from April 15,1925, to July 1, 1928.
